reviews.text: The train station operates hourly services in each direction which is enough to meet the demand of the local area. There's parking available for any commuters who may wish to travel from here. The station itself gets vandalized or left in a state of disrepair on a semi-regular basis but the damage is usually fixed up after a few days.

An hourly service between Wakefield and Knottingley is a good one. They could run through to Goole fairly soon. Another improvement could result in trains running from Wakefield to Selby via here.
Friends of Pontefract Stations can campaign for the four stations and help  raise funds and resources for them.
I've been here a few times.
Trains are usually on time on this line and you'll get a seat most days. Unmanned station so but your ticket on the train.
